answers.answer: The word "hepatitis" just means inflammation of the liver.Many different things can cause inflammation.Here's just a few examples:alcohol, drugs, obesity, diabetes, iron overload, copper overload,autoimmune disorders,..........OR viruses (hepatitis A, B, C, D, E, F, G.)
Right.  She needs to ask her doctor if she has a viral hepatitis (A, B or C) or the non-viral hepatitis.

question: My sister was diagnosed with hepatitis due to some activity to her liver. She knows it has something to do with her drinking, but she didn't know all the specifics. So, she came to me because she thought I could help her understand what is going on in her body. I don't have all the answers, so I am asking you, because I wouldn't feel quit right to talk to her doctor. She only knows that she has some type of hepatitis to her liver, and that it causes her some ailments. She wants to know what she is drinking that would cause this reaction to her.  She also wants to know what kind of hepatitis it is. (A,B,C, or if there is a title.)  Please let me know.. Thank You
title: Not sure the difference
